Package autumn.lang.internals

Class ModuleDelegate

java.lang.Object
autumn.lang.internals.AbstractFunctor
autumn.lang.internals.AbstractTypedFunctor
autumn.lang.internals.AbstractDelegate
autumn.lang.internals.ModuleDelegate
All Implemented Interfaces:
Delegate, Functor, TypedFunctor
public final class ModuleDelegate extends AbstractDelegate
An instance of this class is a delegate that refers to a function within a module.
Author:
Mackenzie High

  • Constructor Details

    • ModuleDelegate

      public ModuleDelegate(Module owner, String name, List<Class> parameters, Class returns, int index)
      Sole Constructor.
      Parameters:
      owner - is the module that contains the referenced function.
      name - is the name of the referenced function.
      parameters - are the types of the function's formal parameters.
      returns - is the function's return-type.
      index - is the index of the function within the module.

  • Method Details

    • module

      public Module module()
      This method retrieves the module that contains the delegated function.
      Returns:
      the module that contains the function that this delegate refers to.

    • owner

      public Class owner()
      This method retrieves the type that owns the method that is invoked by this delegate.
      Returns:
      the owner of the underlying method.

    • name

      public String name()
      This method retrieves the name of the method that is invoked by this delegate.
      Returns:
      the name of the underlying method.

    • returnType

      public Class returnType()
      This method retrieves the return-type of the the method that is invoked by this delegate.
      Returns:
      the return-type of the underlying method.

    • parameterTypes

      public List<Class> parameterTypes()
      This method retrieves the types of the functor's formal-parameters.
      Returns:
      an immutable list of the formal-parameter's types.

    • apply

      public void apply(ArgumentStack stack) throws Throwable
      This method performs an invocation of this function object.

      Programmers should not call this method directly. Instead, for convenience, call this method indirectly via (F::apply List).

      Calling Convention from top to bottom (n >= 0):

      1. argument[n]
      2. argument[.]
      3. argument[2]
      4. argument[1]
      5. argument[0]

      The argument stack will be cleared and then the result will be pushed onto it. If the functor does not return a value, then the stack will remain empty.

      Parameters:
      stack - is a stack containing the arguments being passed to this functor.
      Throws:
      Throwable - in order to propagate exceptions thrown by the functor.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class AbstractDelegate
